     Select2 third-party plugin

    Select2 gives you a customizable select box with support for searching, tagging, remote data sets, infinite scrolling, and many other highly used options.
    This is third-party plugin. To use this plugin you must download it from the home page.

    Direct init
    Select a state
    Metro UI CSS init
    Select a state
    Metro UI CSS init with options
    Select a state
    Multiple
    • ×Alaska
    Select states
    error
    warning
    success
    info
    required

    Important! States for select object displayed only for select placed in input-control container.

    How to use

    Include Select2 plugin
    1. <script src="select2.min.js"></script>
    Direct initialization
    1. <select id="select">
    2.     <option>option</option>
    3.     ...
    4.     <option>option</option>
    5. </select>
    7. <script>
    8.     $(function(){
    9.         $("#select").select2();
    10.     });
    11. </script>
    Metro UI CSS declarative style
    1. <div class="input-control" data-role="select">
    2.     <select>
    3.     <option>option</option>
    4.     ...
    5.     <option>option</option>
    6.     </select>
    7. </div>
    9. <div class="input-control error" data-role="select">
    10.     <select>
    11.     <option>option</option>
    12.     ...
    13.     <option>option</option>
    14.     </select>
    15. </div>
    Metro UI CSS declarative style with options
    1. <div class="input-control" data-template-result="fmtState" data-role="select">
    2.     <select>
    3.         <option>option</option>
    4.         ...
    5.         <option>option</option>
    6.     </select>
    7. </div>
    9. <script>
    10.     function fmtState (state) {
    11.         if (!state.id) { return state.text; }
    12.         var $state = $(
    13.             '<span>'+
    14.             '<img src="images/flags/' +
    15.             state.element.value.toLowerCase() +
    16.             '.png" class="img-flag" /> ' +
    17.             state.text +
    18.             '</span>'
    19.         );
    20.         return $state;
    21.     }
    22. </script>
